text: Zev Buffman (October 11, 1930 â€“ March 31, 2020) was an Israeli Broadway producer. He was President and CEO of Ruth Eckerd Hall in Clearwater, Florida. He made more than 40 Broadway shows. He partnered with Elizabeth Taylor to present her in her Broadway debut, The Little Foxes. Buffman was also the co- founding General Partner of the NBA Champion Basketball team the Miami Heat. In 2011-2018, Buffman was named the President & CEO of Ruth Eckerd Hall. Buffman died at a hospital in Seattle of pancreatic cancer on March 31, 2020 at the age of 89.Zev Buffman, 89, Prolific Producer From Broadway to Florida, Dies ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Israeli businesspeople Category:People from Tel Aviv Category:Theatre producers
